goal.core.mas

Class AgentFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • goal.core.mas.AgentFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class AgentFile
extends ParsedObject
    An AgentFile contains one line in the MAS file agentfiles section, like this "tictactoe.goal" [name = player, language=K]. The quoted string refers to the filename. But it is not a full qualified filename, it still needs to be resolved. See #resolvePath(String). The name=X part is an alias for this file, to be used in the launchpolicy section. The language=K part specifies which KRLanguage is used in the agent.

    Note that the filename may not be resolvable. The file can be in multiple locations (see PlatformManager.resolveFileReference(String, String) .Therefore the unresolved string as given in the MAS file is stored here, as well as the MAS file directory. Resolving is done on an as-needed basis. An agent file encapsulates

    • The agent (.goal) file,
    • The name of the agent, and
    • The associated knowledge representation language.
    Author:
    Tristan Behrens
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • AgentFile

        public AgentFile(java.lang.String filename,
         java.lang.String masdir,
         InputStreamPosition source)
        Creates a new AgentFile descriptor.
        Parameters:
        filename - the given filename in the MAS. May be absolute or relative path.
        masdir - the directory of the MAS itself that contains this reference. Needed to resolve the filename.
        source - Where in the .mas file the definition of the agent file starts.
